alert.note: Alert for Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the Des Lacs River at Foxholm affecting Ward County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Des Lacs River at Foxholm. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1652.5 feet, Average height of ground around gage house. At 1653.0 feet, Homes in Foxholm close to the Des Lacs can be affected as water encroaches on them. Lower elevation homes along Project Road near Burlington suffer damage even with no releases from Lake Darling. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 1651.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 1652.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It is likely to fall below flood stage late tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 1651.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1652.2 feet on 04/13/2009. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
